intro: Pimpinella cypria, commonly known as Cyprus cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, followed by small, heart-shaped seeds. Pimpinella cypria is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
